Happy New Year 2025 LIVE: US rings in 2025 with dazzling fireworks display | Today News - Mint
As it happened | New Year 2025 Celebrations: New York City welcomes 2025 with Ball Drop moment - WION
summary:
World Welcomes 2025: Global New Year Celebrations

Published on January 1, 2025 - Source: The Public Live

The New Year's celebrations took place across the world as people enthusiastically marked the arrival of 2025. From small islands in the Pacific to energetic and busy cities, all welcomed the New Year with passion and thrill.

  1. New York City welcomed 2025 with the iconic 'Ball Drop' tradition at Times Square.
  2. The Rio Mayor's Press Office considers the New Year's Eve celebration in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, the world's biggest, with 2 million people expected to attend.
  3. The first ball drop in New York happened on December 31, 1907, and has been held every year since, except for 1942 and 1943 due to wartime blackouts.
  4. New Year celebrations around the world kicked off with fireworks and other festivities, including in Sydney, Australia, and New Zealand.
  5. Some countries held muted New Year events, such as South Korea, following recent tragic events.

New York City’s iconic Times Square was electric last night as the clock struck midnight, ringing in the year 2025 with an unforgettable celebration. Crowds gathered, bundled up and buzzing with excitement, to witness the historic ball drop, one of the most anticipated moments in… pic.twitter.com/GTAqYy619Y

— NYC Scoop (@NY_Scoop) January 1, 2025
newTitle: World Welcomes 2025: Global New Year Celebrations

Watch: China rings in New Year with incredible drone show - Deccan Herald
summary:
Watch: China rings in New Year with incredible drone show

Date: 01 January 2025, Source: IST

China celebrated New Year's Eve with an impressive drone show featuring over 10,000 drones lighting up the sky. President Xi Jinping addressed the nation, acknowledging economic challenges while urging confidence in a brighter future.

  • The drone show included stunning visuals, with a dragon gliding through the air.
  • Xi Jinping recognized the difficulties facing the economy and pledged governmental efforts for growth.
  • In his speech, Xi reaffirmed Taiwan's status as part of China.
  • Other global cities, such as Auckland and Sydney, also celebrated with fireworks and light displays.
“The current economic operation is facing some new situations, there are challenges from the uncertainty of the external environment...” - Xi Jinping

China's display sets a vibrant tone for the New Year, showcasing technological innovation and a spirit of resilience amidst challenges.
newTitle: China Welcomes 2025 with Spectacular Drone Show

title: Heartbreaking Last Photo Of Boy, 3, Youngest Victim Killed In South Korea Plane Crash - News18
summary:
Heartbreaking Last Photo Of Boy, 3, Youngest Victim Killed In South Korea Plane Crash

Date: January 01, 2025

Source: News18

A devastating final photo emerged of the three-year-old boy who was killed in the South Korean plane crash alongside his parents. Kang Ko, his wife Jin Lee Seon and their son were killed when the Jeju Air Boeing 737-800 crashed while attempting an emergency landing at Muan International Airport.

  • The three-year-old boy was on his first trip abroad to celebrate Christmas with his family.
  • Kang Ko worked in public relations for the Kia Tigers baseball team.
  • Of the 181 people onboard, only two flight attendants survived the plane crash.
  • Authorities are investigating the cause of the crash.
“He was so good at his job that everyone on our company’s baseball broadcasting team liked him. We waited until the end for news of a miraculous return... In the end, he never returned. Not even his family.” - Sports broadcaster Jung Woo-young

This tragic event highlights the fragility of life and the overwhelming impact of such incidents on families and communities.
newTitle: Heartbreaking Last Photo Of Boy, 3, Youngest Victim Killed In South Korea Plane Crash

title: Abu Dhabi welcomes 2025 with fireworks and drone show, setting Guinness world records - Hindustan Times
summary:
Abu Dhabi dazzled the world with a 50-minute fireworks display and a 6,000-drone show, breaking six Guinness World Records to mark the New Year.

Date: Jan 01, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Abu Dhabi dazzled the world with an unforgettable New Year’s Eve celebration, hosting the largest fireworks display at the Sheikh Zayed Festival in Al Wathba. The breathtaking spectacle, which lasted 50 minutes, captivated audiences and set six new Guinness World Records.

  • The 6,000-drone show illuminated the skies for over 20 minutes, forming intricate aerial art.
  • Fireworks displays occurred every hour from 6 p.m. leading to a stunning midnight showcase.
  • Major locations in Abu Dhabi, including Yas Island and the Corniche, participated in the celebrations.
  • In 2023, the festival set three Guinness World Records for its previous fireworks display.
  • The Sheikh Zayed Festival features a variety of attractions, including laser shows and cultural performances.
"This year's event reflects Abu Dhabi’s commitment to outshining its previous records."

The celebrations demonstrated Abu Dhabi's vibrant culture and its aim to create memorable experiences, marking a remarkable start to the new year.
newTitle: Abu Dhabi Welcomes 2025 with Dazzling Fireworks and Drone Show

title: Happy New Year 2025 Celebrations LIVE Updates: PM Modi extends New Year’s greetings, says ‘may this year bring new opportunities, success’ - The Indian Express
summary:
Happy New Year 2025 Celebrations LIVE Updates

Date: January 1, 2025 - Source: The Indian Express

As India welcomed 2025, President Droupadi Murmu greet the citizens, urging a collective commitment towards a brighter, inclusive, and sustainable future. Prime Minister Narendra Modi also expressed hopes for new opportunities in the upcoming year.

  • Global celebrations included fireworks in major cities like Sydney, London, and Rio De Janeiro.
  • New York's iconic Ball Drop featured performances from various artists such as Kesha and The Jonas Brothers.
  • In India, police enforced measures to ensure safety during celebrations, including bans on firecrackers and deployment in major cities.
“Let us renew our commitment to work together for a brighter, more inclusive and sustainable future.” - President Droupadi Murmu

The New Year celebrations are marked by joy, music, and family gatherings, ushering in a year full of hope and new possibilities.
newTitle: Live Updates on Happy New Year 2025 Celebrations: President Murmu's Message for a Brighter Future

title: Suchir Balaji’s mother alleges ‘murder’, demands FBI investigation into OpenAI whistleblower’s death - The Hindu
summary:
Suchir Balaji’s Mother Alleges Murder, Seeks FBI Investigation into Whistleblower's Death

Date: January 01, 2025

Source: Fox News

Suchir Balaji's mother, Poornima Rao, has accused authorities of declaring her son's death a suicide when she believes it to be murder. She is calling for an FBI investigation into the circumstances surrounding his death.

  • Suchir Balaji was found dead in his apartment in San Francisco.
  • His mother claims there were signs of struggle and that the apartment was ransacked.
  • A private autopsy contradicted the police report regarding the cause of death.
  • Elon Musk publicly expressed skepticism about the suicide ruling.
  • Balaji previously accused OpenAI of copyright violations related to generative AI.
“It's a cold blooded mu*d*r declared by authorities as suicide. We demand FBI investigation.” - Poornima Rao

This case has garnered significant attention, highlighting concerns about the treatment of whistleblowers and the implications of AI technology.
newTitle: Suchir Balaji’s Mother Alleges Murder, Seeks FBI Investigation into Whistleblower's Death

title: New gun laws rolling out in multiple US states on Jan 1 - Greatandhra
summary:
New Gun Laws Rolling Out in Multiple US States on January 1

Publication Date: January 1, 2024

Source: Xinhua News Agency

US states are implementing various gun regulations starting January 1, amidst ongoing violence and nearly 500 mass shootings in 2024. These laws aim to enhance gun safety and prevention efforts.

  • In California, Governor Gavin Newsom signed laws for stricter gun safety regulations, including the establishment of an Office of Gun Violence Prevention.
  • In Colorado, handguns in unoccupied vehicles must be stored in locked containers, and concealed carry permit applicants will require eight hours of training starting in 2025.
  • New Hampshire expanded gun rights with laws improving privacy protections related to gun ownership.
  • Kentucky has joined states banning merchant category codes for gun retailers.
  • Minnesota has enacted a binary trigger ban effective January 1.
  • Delaware is extending its Safe School Zone regulations to include university campuses.
California has seen a significant push for stronger gun regulations, amidst a backdrop of rising gun violence across states.

This wave of new gun laws reflects a growing concern over gun violence in the US, as states take action to enhance safety and regulation in response to public demand.
newTitle: New Gun Laws Rolling Out in Multiple US States on January 1

title: 'It Ends With Us' director Justin Baldoni files $250 MILLION lawsuit against The New York Times for libel - TOI Etimes
summary:
'It Ends With Us' Director Files $250 Million Lawsuit Against The New York Times

Publication Date: Not specified, Source: Times of India

The legal dispute intensifies the controversy around the film 'It Ends With Us', with director Justin Baldoni suing The New York Times for $250 million in a case alleging libel and invasion of privacy.

  • Justin Baldoni alleges that The New York Times published defamatory claims about him, stemming from allegations made by actress Blake Lively.
  • The lawsuit was filed in Los Angeles Superior Court on New Year's Eve and includes co-plaintiffs such as publicists and producers.
  • Baldoni's attorney claims the article relied on manipulated communications that misrepresented events.
  • Specific incidents cited include misleading portrayals of text messages between Baldoni and Lively.
  • Both The New York Times and Blake Lively's team have publicly responded to the allegations.
  • The film premiered amidst controversies and successful box office performance, drawing attention to tensions between Baldoni and Lively.
“In this vicious smear campaign fully orchestrated by Blake Lively and her team, The New York Times cowered to the wants and whims of two powerful 'untouchable' Hollywood elites...” - Attorney Bryan Freedman

The ongoing legal battle highlights the complex dynamics of celebrity relationships and media narratives, with significant questions about the responsibility of news organizations in reporting on personal conflicts.
newTitle: 'It Ends With Us' Director Files $250 Million Lawsuit Against The New York Times

title: 'Inauspicious Start To 2025': Lightning Strikes US Capitol, Netizens Link It To Trump | Video - News18
summary:
Lightning Strikes US Capitol and Washington Monument on New Year’s Eve

Date: January 01, 2025 Source: News18

On New Year’s Eve, lightning struck both the US Capitol building and the Washington Monument, sparking discussions on social media regarding its implications.

  • Lightning struck the US Capitol and Washington Monument at the same time.
  • Netizens interpreted the event as a sign or omen, often linked to political beliefs.
  • One user stated, “A sign that lightning often strikes the tallest objects.”
“In what may be an inauspicious start for the 2025 Republican trifecta, it looks like the Washington Monument and the US Capitol building were struck by lightning tonight.” — katya (@EhresmanKatya)

This unusual occurrence has led to intense speculation on its significance as the year begins.
newTitle: Lightning Strikes US Capitol and Washington Monument on New Year’s Eve

From Sydney to Dubai: World’s spectacular NYE fireworks

New Year’s Eve celebrations unfolded worldwide, showcasing breathtaking fireworks across several major cities, marking the transition into 2025.

  • Fireworks lit up the skies in Sydney, Hong Kong, Dubai, and many other locations.
  • Sydney’s iconic Harbour Bridge and Opera House were focal points for the celebrations.
  • Dubai featured stunning displays near the Burj Khalifa, the tallest building in the world.

title: Two Teens Hospitalized After Stabbings During New Year’s Eve Celebrations In Australia - Zee News
summary:
New Year’s Eve Stabbings in Australia

Date & Source: January 1, 2023, Zee News

Two teenagers were hospitalized following separate stabbing incidents during New Year’s Eve celebrations in Sydney and Melbourne. Authorities confirmed these incidents amidst large-scale festivities across the cities.

  1. In Sydney, a 17-year-old boy was stabbed in the back in Guildford park while a group was setting off fireworks illegally.
  2. The victim was transported to a hospital, and the attacker fled the scene. Police made 36 arrests for various offenses during the celebrations.
  3. In Melbourne, another teenager was stabbed, and details about this case remain limited.
New South Wales Police called for witnesses to come forward and emphasized responsible behavior during large gatherings.

Stay informed on all the latest news, real-time breaking news updates, and follow all the important headlines in India news and World News on Zee News.
newTitle: New Year's Eve Stabbings in Australia: Two Teenagers Hospitalized

title: China steps up drive to break Boeing and Airbus grip on plane market - Financial Times
summary:
China's Bid to Challenge Boeing and Airbus in the Aircraft Market

Date: October 2023

Source: Financial Times

The article discusses China's initiative to reduce the dominance of Boeing and Airbus in the aircraft market, focusing on the efforts of state-run manufacturer Comac and its C919 aircraft.

Key Points:

  • The C919 made its first commercial flight in 2023 and is now flying domestic routes.
  • Comac aims to expand C919 operations to Southeast Asia by 2026 and seeks European certification.
  • The global aviation market requires 42,430 new aircraft in the next two decades.
  • Comac faces challenges with certification and maintenance support for international markets.
  • Comac is also developing a widebody aircraft, the C929, expected to enter service after 2040.
“Maintenance support is the main issue,” said a person close to Indonesia’s TransNusa.

In conclusion, while Comac is positioned to grow, significant hurdles remain before it can effectively compete with established giants in the global aircraft market.
newTitle: China's Bid to Challenge Boeing and Airbus in the Aircraft Market

title: Kathy Hochul ripped for 'taking victory lap' with new post on same day subway fire victim identified, ‘Disaster for NY’ - Hindustan Times
summary:
Kathy Hochul Faces Backlash for Victory Lap Amid Subway Fire Victim Identification

Publication Date: Jan 01, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

New York Governor Kathy Hochul is criticized for celebrating the state's successes through a video post on the same day Debrina Kawam, the victim of a subway fire, was identified.

  • Hochul highlighted achievements including a minimum wage increase and online safety legislation.
  • Her post faced severe backlash from public representatives and citizens alike.
  • Critics questioned her focus on victories while subway safety remains an issue.
Rep. Ritchie Torres stated: "Governor Hochul feels the need to take a victory lap. 'Mission accomplished' is the ultimate form of gaslighting."

This incident has led to heightened criticism of Hochul’s leadership and has sparked debates regarding public safety in New York.
newTitle: Kathy Hochul Faces Backlash for Victory Lap Amid Subway Fire Victim Identification

title: Armed With ‘Cutting Edge’ Vertical Launch Missile System, North Korea Reveals Largest-Ever Warship - EurAsian Times
summary:
North Korea Unveils Largest-Ever Warship with Advanced Missile System

Date: December 29, 2024 | Source: Korean Central Television

North Korea has showcased the largest warship under construction in its Navy, featuring a cutting-edge vertical launch missile system, indicating a substantial enhancement of its maritime strength.

  • The images depict Kim Jong Un inspecting the vessel, which is likely being built at the Nampo Shipyard.
  • The warship is approximately 100 meters long and has a beam width of about 15 meters.
  • Experts believe the warship will include advanced features, including vertical launch systems and radar technologies.
  • Analysts note that this development does not position North Korea's navy to compete with US or South Korean naval capabilities.
Joseph Dempsey, a researcher, noted that the dockyard includes structures designed to conceal construction.

This reveal marks another significant advancement within North Korea's ongoing efforts to strengthen its naval forces.
newTitle: North Korea Unveils Largest-Ever Warship with Advanced Missile System

Israel eliminates Hamas commander Abd al-Hadi Sabah linked to Kibbutz Nir Oz attack on October 7

The Israeli Defense Forces carried out an operation resulting in the elimination of a prominent Hamas commander, Abd al-Hadi Sabah, who was linked to a recent attack on Kibbutz Nir Oz.

  • Abd al-Hadi Sabah was reportedly responsible for orchestrating attacks against Israel.
  • The strike aimed to weaken Hamas' operational capabilities.
  • The operation highlights ongoing tensions in the region and Israel's commitment to counter-terrorism.
“This operation sends a clear message to Hamas that we will not tolerate attacks on our citizens,” said an IDF spokesperson.

This targeted action marks another chapter in the ongoing conflict and Israel's significant military efforts against organized threats.

title: Happy New Year 2025 LIVE: India and cities around the world rings in 2025 with fireworks and grand celebrations | Today News - Mint
summary:
Happy New Year 2025 LIVE: India and cities around the world rings in 2025 with fireworks and grand celebrations

Date: 31 Dec, 2024
Source: HT Digital Streams Limited

As the clock strikes midnight, 2025 ushers in a new year across India and worldwide, celebrated with fireworks and joy. From Sydney to Mumbai, cities are filled with excitement and reflection.

  • New Zealand and Australia led the celebrations with vibrant fireworks displays.
  • Heavy snowfall in Japan led to the cancellation of around 42 flights.
  • Globally, gatherings are taking place despite some regions facing severe weather disruptions.
  • The world population reached 8.09 billion on New Year’s Day, according to estimates.
“More than 71 million people were added to the global population in 2024.” - US Census Bureau

2025 has arrived with promises of hope and new beginnings as millions reflect on the past year and set intentions for the year to come.

title: Indian-origin doctor dies in UAE plane crash along with pilot: Report - Hindustan Times
summary:
Indian-origin doctor dies in UAE plane crash along with pilot: Report

Date: Jan 01, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

An Indian-origin doctor, Sulaymaan Al Majid, tragically died in a plane crash off the coast of Ras Al Khaimah along with the pilot on December 26. He was 26 years old and was taking a sightseeing flight with his family present at the aviation club.

  • The crash occurred shortly after takeoff near the Cove Rotana Hotel.
  • Sulaymaan had rented the light aircraft, and his family was there to watch his flight.
  • Both he and the Pakistani pilot did not survive the incident, with investigations by the GCAA ongoing.
  • His father described their grief and how they were looking forward to New Year celebrations together.
  • Sulaymaan was a clinical fellow at the County Durham and Darlington NHS NHS Trust in the UK.
“At first, we were told the glider had lost radio contact... Sulaymaan passed away before we could see him.” - Majid Mukarram, Sulaymaan's father

This devastating loss has left the family in profound grief, impacting their future deeply without Sulaymaan.
newTitle: Indian-origin doctor dies in UAE plane crash along with pilot: Report
